description: From German Sinter. Doublet of cinder.

entries.meaning: (geology) An alluvial sediment deposited by a mineral spring.
examples: That water at a high temperature can hold quartz in solution is well illustrated by the deposits of silicious sinter, thrown down by thermal springs,  [â€¦]
Consider a copper sinter material with spherical sinter particles in an early stage of the sintering process, see Fig. 3.5(a).

entries.meaning: A mixture of iron ore and fluxes added to a blast furnace.

verbs.description: sinter (third-person singular simple present sinters, present participle sintering, simple past and past participle sintered)

entries.meaning: To compact and heat a powder to form a solid mass.
examples: Most, if not all, metals may be sintered.
